meanings.definition: To beat or thrash with a flail.
meanings.sent1: The farmer swingled the wheat to separate the grains.
meanings.sent2: She swingled the rug to remove the dust.
meanings.sent3: The children swingled the pinata at the party.
meanings.sent4: The wind swingled the branches of the tree gently.
meanings.sent5: The drummer swingled the drumsticks to create a rhythm.

meanings.definition: To clean or separate fibers from flax or hemp using a swingle.
meanings.sent1: She swingled the flax to extract the fibers.
meanings.sent2: The worker swingled the hemp to prepare it for weaving.
meanings.sent3: The tailor swingled the fabric to make it softer.
meanings.sent4: The machine swingled the fibers with precision.
meanings.sent5: The artist swingled the flax to create a unique texture.

meanings.definition: To swing or sway back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The pendulum swingled gently in the clock.
meanings.sent2: The branches swingled in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The swingled boat rocked on the calm water.
meanings.sent4: The swingled chandelier cast moving shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The swingled hammock provided a relaxing sway.
